name: Peru
introduction: Ancient Peru was the seat of several prominent Andean civilizations most notably that of the Incas whose empire was captured by Spanish conquistadors in 1533. Peru declared its independence in 1821 and remaining Spanish forces were defeated in 1824. After a dozen years of military rule Peru returned to democratic leadership in 1980 but experienced economic problems and the growth of a violent insurgency. President Alberto FUJIMORI's election in 1990 ushered in a decade that saw a dramatic turnaround in the economy and significant progress in curtailing guerrilla activity. Nevertheless the president's increasing reliance on authoritarian measures and an economic slump in the late 1990s generated mounting dissatisfaction with his regime which led to his resignation in 2000. A caretaker government oversaw a new election in the spring of 2001 which installed Alejandro TOLEDO Manrique as the new head of government - Peru's first democratically elected president of indigenous ethnicity. The presidential election of 2006 saw the return of Alan GARCIA Perez who after a disappointing presidential term from 1985 to 1990 oversaw a robust economic rebound. Former army officer Ollanta HUMALA Tasso was elected president in June 2011 and carried on the sound market-oriented economic policies of the three preceding administrations. Poverty and unemployment levels have fallen dramatically in the last decade and today Peru boasts one of the best performing economies in Latin America. Pedro Pablo KUCZYNSKI Godard won a very narrow presidential runoff election in June 2016.
overview: 'Peru is a country in South America that''s home to a section of Amazon rainforest and Machu Picchu an ancient Incan city high in the Andes mountains. The region around Machu Picchu including the Sacred Valley Inca Trail and colonial city of Cusco is rich in archaeological sites. On Peru’s arid Pacific coast is Lima the capital with a preserved colonial center and important collections of pre-Columbian art.'

languages.name: Achuar-Shiwiar
languages.area: Morona, Macusari, Tigre, Huasaga, and Corrientes rivers. Also in Ecuador.

languages.name: Aguano
languages.area: Lower Huallaga and upper Samiria rivers, right bank tributary of Marañon River.

languages.name: Aguaruna
languages.area: Western upper Marañon River area, Potro, Mayo, and Cahuapanas rivers.

languages.name: Amahuaca
languages.area: Southeast Amazon Basin, scattered in Ucayali and Madre de Dios states on the following rivers: Sepahua, Curiuja, Curanja, Upper Ucayali, Inuya, Mapuya, Purus, Aguaytía, Yuruá, Las Piedras. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Yanesha'
languages.area: Central and east Pasco region; Junín, western jungle, headwaters of Pachitea and Perene rivers.

languages.name: Aratbuten huaʼa
languages.area: Madre de Dios and Colorado rivers.

languages.name: Andoa
languages.area: Pastaza River.

languages.name: Arabela
languages.area: Arabela River, tributary of Napo. 2 villages.

languages.name: Abishira
languages.area: Puerto Elvira on Lake Vacacocha on Napo River.

languages.name: Aushiri
languages.area: Napo River right bank tributaries, Escuelacocha.

languages.name: Southern Aymara
languages.area: From Lake Titicaca toward ocean.

languages.name: Central Aymara
languages.area: Whole Altiplano west of eastern Andes. Some migration to yungas and lowlands. Also in Argentina, Chile, Peru.

languages.name: Bora
languages.area: Northeast Yaguasyacu, Putumayo, Ampiyacu River area. 5 villages. Also in Brazil, Colombia.

languages.name: Cahuarano
languages.area: Nanay River.

languages.name: Cashibo-Cacataibo
languages.area: Aguaytía, San Alejandro, Súngaro rivers.

languages.name: Cashinahua
languages.area: Curanja and Purus rivers. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Chayahuita
languages.area: Paranapura, Cahuapanas, Sillay, Shanusi rivers.

languages.name: Candoshi-Shapra
languages.area: Morona, Pastaza, Huitoyacu, Chapuli rivers.

languages.name: Chamicuro
languages.area: Pampa Hermosa, Huallaga tributary.

languages.name: Cholón
languages.area: Huallaga River valley from Tingo María to Valle.

languages.name: Ashéninka Pajonal
languages.area: Central Gran Pajonal area.

languages.name: Asháninka
languages.area: Apurimac, Ene, Perene, Tambo rivers and tributaries.

languages.name: Cocama-Cocamilla
languages.area: Northeast lower Ucayali, lower Marañon, and Huallaga rivers area. Also in Brazil, Colombia.

languages.name: Caquinte
languages.area: Poyeni, Mayapo, and Picha rivers. Upper Poyeni River, which flows into Tambo Yori and Agueni rivers which become Mipaya River flowing into the Urubamba; a few on Sensa and Vitiricaya rivers, affluents of the Urubamba.

languages.name: Nanti
languages.area: Headwaters of Camisea and Timpia rivers.

languages.name: Ucayali-Yurúa Ashéninka
languages.area: Ucayali River tributaries (Pachitea, Arruya, Shahuaya, Sheshea, Cohengua, Inuya), Yurúa River. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Ajyíninka Apurucayali
languages.area: Apurucayali tributary of Pachitea River.

languages.name: Pichis Ashéninka
languages.area: Pichis and tributaries except Apurucayali.

languages.name: South Ucayali Ashéninka
languages.area: Upper Ucayali River and tributaries (Southernmost part of Ucayali Department).

languages.name: Mashco Piro
languages.area: Manu Park, Madre de Dios Deparment. Cujar, Purus, Tahuamanu, Mishagua, and Piedras rivers.

languages.name: Culina
languages.area: Amazonas, Acre. Also in Peru.

languages.name: German
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hungary, Israel, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Moldova, Mozambique, Namibia, Paraguay, Philippines, Poland, Puerto Rico, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United States, Uruguay, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Modern Greek (1453-)
languages.area: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Also in Albania, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, France, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey (Europe), Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Ese Ejja
languages.area: Northwestern region; into foothills on Beni and Madre de Dios rivers; Tambopata and Heath rivers around Puerto Maldonado in Peru. Also in Peru.

languages.name: Hibito
languages.area: Bobonaje River, Jelache tributary, Huayabamba tributary entering Huallaga on west.

languages.name: Huambisa
languages.area: Morona and Santiago rivers.

languages.name: Huachipaeri
languages.area: Upper Madre de Dios and Keros rivers.

languages.name: Murui Huitoto
languages.area: Northeast Peru, southwest Colombia. Ampiyacu, Putumayo, and Napo rivers; north of Amazon River between Iquitos, Peru and Leticia, Colombia on the south, Caquetá River north. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Iñapari
languages.area: Piedras River, mouth of Sabaluyo, near Puerto Maldonado.

languages.name: Iquito
languages.area: Loreto Province, Pintoyacu, Nanay, and Chambira rivers; San Antonia and Atalaya.

languages.name: Isconahua
languages.area: Callaria River.

languages.name: Jebero
languages.area: Jebero District.

languages.name: Japanese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in American Samoa, Argentina, Australia, Belize, Brazil, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Guam, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Palau, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Jaqaru
languages.area: Lima Department, Yauyos Province, Tupe (Jaqaru) and Cachuy villages (Cauqui).

languages.name: Capanahua
languages.area: Tapiche-Buncuya rivers area.

languages.name: Machiguenga
languages.area: Urubamba, Camisea, Picha, Manu, Timpia, Tigompinia, Kompiroshiato, and Mishagua rivers.

languages.name: Sharanahua
languages.area: Upper Purus River area. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Matsés
languages.area: Yaquerana. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Yora
languages.area: Manu Park, Panagua River; Mishagua River. May be some in Brazil.

languages.name: Muniche
languages.area: Paranapura River, Muniches town.

languages.name: Nomatsiguenga
languages.area: Junín Department, between rivers Ene and Perene, Anapati River system in the foothills.

languages.name: Ocaina
languages.area: Northeast Peru, Yaguasyacu, Ampuyacu, and Putumayo rivers. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Omagua
languages.area: Omaguas near Iquitos. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Orejón
languages.area: Yanayacu, Sucusari, Algodon, and Putumayo rivers.

languages.name: Yine
languages.area: Ucayali and Cusco departments, east central Urubamba River area; Ucayali and Loreto departments, along Ucayali River (Conatmana and Pucallpa); Department of Madre de Dios, Madre de Dios River.

languages.name: Pisabo
languages.area: Matses territory, between Tapíche and Blanco rivers.

languages.name: Panobo
languages.area: Ucayali River mixed with the Shetebo.

languages.name: Ashéninka Perené
languages.area: Upper Perené River (tributary of Pachitea River).

languages.name: Huallaga Huánuco Quechua
languages.area: Northeast Huánuco Department, Huánuco City.

languages.name: Lambayeque Quechua
languages.area: Lambayeque region; Inkawasi, Kañaris, and Miracosta districts, and Penachí and Santa Lucía communities; adjacent areas of other departments (Cajamarca, Piura).

languages.name: Chachapoyas Quechua
languages.area: Amazonas Department, Chachapoyas and Luya provinces.

languages.name: Southern Pastaza Quechua
languages.area: North jungle, Anatico Lake, Pastaza and Huasaga rivers, along Ñucuray River and Manchari.

languages.name: Yanahuanca Pasco Quechua
languages.area: West Pasco Department; Yanahuanca, Villcabamba, Tapoc, Chacayan, Paucar, San Pedro de Pillao, Goyllarisquizqa, Chinche districts; sparsely populated high country, more densely populated valleys.

languages.name: Yauyos Quechua
languages.area: Lima Department, Yauyos Province; Ica Department, Chincha Province, north section; Huancavelica Department, Castrovirreyna Province, northeast corner.

languages.name: Ayacucho Quechua
languages.area: Southwest Ayacucho region and Lima.

languages.name: Cusco Quechua
languages.area: Departments of Cusco, half of Puno, and northeast Arequipa.

languages.name: Ambo-Pasco Quechua
languages.area: Huánuco Department, Ambo Province, Huacar, San Francisco de Mosca, and San Rafael districts. Pasco Department, Pasco Province, Chaupimarca, Huachón, Huariaca, Ninacaca, Pallanchacra, San Francisco de Asís de Yarusyacán, Simón Bolívar, Ticlacayán, Tinyahuarca, Vicco, and Yanacancha districts.

languages.name: Cajamarca Quechua
languages.area: Cajamarca, Chetilla, and Los Baños districts. Western dialect in Chetilla District; Eastern dialect in Porcón and areas around Cajamarca valley.

languages.name: Eastern Apurímac Quechua
languages.area: Apurímac Department: Abancay, Grau, Cotabambas, Antabamba Ayamaraes, and Andahuaylas provinces; Arequipa Department: La Unión Province.

languages.name: Huamalíes-Dos de Mayo Huánuco Quechua
languages.area: Northwest Huánuco Department.

languages.name: Cajatambo North Lima Quechua
languages.area: Northeast Lima Department: Copa, Cajatambo, Huancapón, northern Manas districts; northeast Gogor and southeast Ancash departments: Pacllón, La Primavera, Mangas (south of Llamac River and east of Pativilca River) districts.

languages.name: Margos-Yarowilca-Lauricocha Quechua
languages.area: Southwest and south central Huánuco Department, Obas, Aparicio Pomares, Cahuac, Chavinillo, Chacabamba, Jacas Chico, Rondos, San Francisco de Asis, Jivia, Baños, Queropalca, Jesús, San Miguel de Cauri, Yarumayo, Margos, and San Pedro de Chaulán districts.

languages.name: North Junín Quechua
languages.area: North Junín Department, Junín, Carhuamayo, Ondores, San Pedro de Cajas districts, southeast of Pasco.

languages.name: Napo Lowland Quechua
languages.area: Napo River region; communities on the Putumayo; Madre de Dios. Also in Colombia, Ecuador.

languages.name: Pacaraos Quechua
languages.area: East central Lima Department, Pacaraos village.

languages.name: San Martín Quechua
languages.area: Loreto Department, San Martín region, Sisa, Lamas, and other districts, and along Ucayali River. Lamas town is cultural center.

languages.name: Huaylla Wanca Quechua
languages.area: South Junín Department, Huancayo and Concepción provinces.

languages.name: Northern Pastaza Quichua
languages.area: Eastern jungle along Bobonaza and Conambo rivers, Pastaza Province. Also in Peru.

languages.name: Corongo Ancash Quechua
languages.area: North Ancash Department, Corongo Province, Aco, Corongo, Cusca, La Pampa, and Yanac districts. Most in Aco and Cusca.

languages.name: Classical Quechua
languages.area: Central Peru.

languages.name: Huaylas Ancash Quechua
languages.area: Central Ancash Department, Huaraz, Carhuaz, Caraz provinces; Callejón de Huaylas.

languages.name: Sihuas Ancash Quechua
languages.area: Ancash Department, Sihuas Province, districts west of Sihuas River and north of Rupac River: southern Quiches, Alfonso Ugarte, Huayllabamba, Sihuas, and western Ragash.

languages.name: Chiquián Ancash Quechua
languages.area: Southeast Ancash Department, Bolognesi Province, Chiquián District, western Bolognesi west of Pativilca River and north of Llamac River, and east Ocros, Corpanqui Valley border. Western Ocros may be included, but the dialect is somewhat different.

languages.name: Chincha Quechua
languages.area: Northeast Chincha Province, Ica; northwest Castrovirreyna Province, Huancavelica; southeast Yauyos Province, Lima.

languages.name: Panao Huánuco Quechua
languages.area: East central Huánuco Department.

languages.name: Northern Conchucos Ancash Quechua
languages.area: East Ancash Department, Pomabamba to San Luis, and Huacrachuco in northwest Huánuco Department; possibly north Marañon area.

languages.name: Southern Conchucos Ancash Quechua
languages.area: East Ancash Department, Chavín to San Luis to Llamellín; northwest Huánuco Department: Huacaybamba, Huacrachuco, San Buenaventura, and Pinra districts, much of southern Marañon Province.

languages.name: Puno Quechua
languages.area: Puno Department, northeast Arequipa Department, Moquegua Department highland area.

languages.name: Santa Ana de Tusi Pasco Quechua
languages.area: Pasco Department, southeast Daniel Carrión Province.

languages.name: Arequipa-La Unión Quechua
languages.area: Arequipa Department, La Unión Province, Cotahuasi District; Apurímac Department, Antabamba Province.

languages.name: Jauja Wanca Quechua
languages.area: Central Junín Department, Jauja Province.

languages.name: Remo
languages.area: Between Tapiche and Calleria rivers. If they exist, they are in Brazil at Moa River headwaters; but there is no evidence of their existence in Brazil.

languages.name: Resígaro
languages.area: Northeast Peru, Loreto Department, Bora and Ocaina villages.

languages.name: Secoya
languages.area: Northeastern jungle, Aguarico, Cuyabeno, and Eno rivers, near Colombian border. Also in Peru.

languages.name: Shipibo-Conibo
languages.area: Northeast middle Ucayali River area, Painaco, Requena, Sur Bolognesi, Pisqui (on the other side of Contamana).

languages.name: Sensi
languages.area: Right bank of Ucayali River.

languages.name: Spanish
languages.area: Central, south; Canary Islands. Also in Andorra, Anguilla, Argentina, Aruba, Australia, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Canada, Cayman Islands, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Finland, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Guatemala, Honduras, Israel, Jamaica, Mexico, Morocco, Netherlands Antilles, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Uruguay, Venezuela.

languages.name: Loreto-Ucayali Spanish
languages.area: Loreto and Ucayali river areas.

languages.name: Ticuna
languages.area: West Amazonas. Also in Colombia, Peru.

languages.name: Taushiro
languages.area: Off Tigre River, Aucayacu River, Ahuaruna River tributary.

languages.name: Urarina
languages.area: Loreto Department: Urarinas District, Pucayacu, Chambira, and Urituyacu rivers.

languages.name: Yaminahua
languages.area: Yuruá, Mapuya, and Mishagua. Also in Bolivia, Brazil.

languages.name: Yagua
languages.area: Northeast Amazon River region, Loreto, from Iquitos to Brazil border. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Yameo
languages.area: Marañon and Amazon rivers from the mouth of the Tigre to the Nanay River.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.
